# The `Registry` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A global registry used in conjunction with static constructors to make pluggable components (like targets or garbage collectors) &quot;just work&quot; when linked with an executable. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;typename T&gt;
class llvm::Registry&lt;T&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A global registry used in conjunction with static constructors to make pluggable components (like targets or garbage collectors) &quot;just work&quot; when linked with an executable.

Definition at line 44 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/registry-h">Registry.h</a>.

## Public Static Functions

### add&#95;node() {#af1684cbe4fb121267dd3ae2f222f5086}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static void llvm::Registry&lt; T &gt;::add&#95;node (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/registry/node">node</a> &#42; N)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/registry/add">Add</a> a node to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/registry">Registry</a>: this is the interface between the plugin and the executable.

This function is exported by the executable and called by the plugin to add a node to the executable&#39;s registry. Therefore it&#39;s not defined here to avoid it being instantiated in the plugin and is instead defined in the executable (see LLVM&#95;INSTANTIATE&#95;REGISTRY below).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/registry-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/registry-h">Registry.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
